hanzi-su-wiki:
貞

Значения

Верность, целомудрие

Мнемоника

Деньги 貝 оракулу, если гадание 卜 сбылось. Для удачного исхода следует поститься, избегать секса, а на гадание явиться опрятным.

Варианты

贞

purpleculture_examples:
貞操 [ zhēn cāo ]: (usually of women) chastity; virginity; virtue; honor; loyalty; moral integrity
貞節 [ zhēn jié ]: chastity; virginity (of women); moral integrity (of men); loyalty; constancy
貞潔 [ zhēn jié ]: chastity

heisig_chinese_memo: This shellfish forces chaste on fish suffering from sexual addiction by zapping them with his magic wand.
heisig_constituent: upright, magic wand, augury, divining rod, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisig_story: Now take the last primitive, the shellfish, and set a magic wand over it, and you have the kanji for upright. After all, the clam and the oyster are incapable of walking upright. It would take a magician with his wand to pull off such a feat - which is precisely what we have in this kanji.
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: в вертикальном положении, целомудрие, верность, справедливость
koohiiStory1: A magic wand is needed to make a clam stand upright.
koohiiStory2: Just the thought of my magic wand on her clam makes my magic wand stand upright.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You try to put your toe inside a shellfish, but it just won't open. That's because this shellfish has sworn an oath of chastity.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: "No, I won't open up until I meet the toe I will marry," it says to you.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: "Chastity is really important to me," the shellfish says. "But, maybe if you give me a tater (てい) tot, I'll change my mind."
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You give the shellfish a tater tot, and it breaks its vow of chastity, opening up for your toe. You look the other way, but you can hear the sounds of passion below.
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 卜 (гадание), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Ru_trainchinese: zhēn: (графема) (о женщине) целомудренный; верный, преданный; гадать (в древние времена)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish's (貝) divining rod (卜) stands upright
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This shellfish forces chaste on fish suffering from sexual addiction by zapping them with his magic wand.
humanum_full_description_en:
The word " zhen " is used under the guise of " ding " to represent it. Later, " bu " (like 卜兆) is added as a symbol to express the " zhen " of Zhen Bu. "Said Wen": "Zhen, Bu Wen Ye. From Bu, Bei thought Zhi. One is Ding Sheng Sheng. Jing Fang said."

Some foreign scholars pointed out that the inscription " zhen " does not mean "divine question" as in "Shuowen", but means verification, proofreading, and test.

In the early oracle bone inscriptions, the word " ding " was used as the word " zhen " because the pronunciation of " ding " and " zhen " were very similar. Later, " divination " was added to " ding " to express divination. In addition, the simplified form of " ding " is similar to the shape of " bei ", so later generations gradually mistaken it as the word " zhen " from " bu " from " bei ".

Inscriptions on gold sometimes use the word " zhen " to mean " ding ", which refers to a food vessel. In short, the oracle bone " zhen " and " ding " (that is, the word " zhen " written as " ding ") mostly indicate zhen divination, while the inscription " zhen " mostly indicates the " ding " of food utensils , and is also used as a person's name.

" Zhen ", " ding ", and "鼒" are similar in shape and easy to be corrupted. See also " ding " and "鼒".
humanum_short_description_en: The word " zhen " is used under the guise of " ding " to mean, and later " bu " (like 卜兆) is added as a symbol to express the " zhen " of Zhen Bu.
humanum_full_description:
「貞」字假借「鼎」來表示，後來加「卜」(象卜兆)為意符，專門表示貞卜的「貞」。《說文》：「貞，卜問也。从卜，貝以爲贄。一曰鼎省聲。京房所說。」

　　有外國學者指出卜辭「貞」字並非如《說文》所言是「卜問」的意思，而是校驗、校證、試驗(test)的意思。

　　早期甲骨文借「鼎」字為「貞」字，因為「鼎」、「貞」的讀音十分接近，後來在「鼎」上加上「卜」，以表示占卜。又「鼎」形之簡化與「貝」字形近，故後世漸訛為從「卜」從「貝」的「貞」字。

　　金文有時又用「貞」字來表示「鼎」，指食器。簡言之、甲骨「貞」、「鼎」(即寫作「鼎」的「貞」字)多表示貞卜，而金文「貞」字多表示食器之「鼎」，亦有用作人名。

　　「貞」、「鼎」、「鼒」形近易訛，參見「鼎」、「鼒」。
humanum_short_description: 「貞」字假借「鼎」來表示，後來加「卜」(象卜兆)為意符，專門表示貞卜的「貞」。

「 貞 」字假借「 鼎 」來表示，後來加「 卜 」(象卜兆)為意符，專門表示貞卜的「 貞 」。《說文》：「貞，卜問也。从卜，貝以爲贄。一曰鼎省聲。京房所說。」 有外國學者指出卜辭「 貞 」字並非如《說文》所言是「卜問」的意思，而是校驗、校證、試驗(test)的意思。 早期甲骨文借「 鼎 」字為「 貞 」字，因為「 鼎 」、「 貞 」的讀音十分接近，後來在「 鼎 」上加上「 卜 」，以表示占卜。又「 鼎 」形之簡化與「 貝 」字形近，故後世漸訛為從「 卜 」從「 貝 」的「 貞 」字。 金文有時又用「 貞 」字來表示「 鼎 」，指食器。簡言之、甲骨「 貞 」、「 鼎 」(即寫作「 鼎 」的「 貞 」字)多表示貞卜，而金文「 貞 」字多表示食器之「 鼎 」，亦有用作人名。 「 貞 」、「 鼎 」、「 鼒 」形近易訛，參見「 鼎 」、「 鼒 」。
The word " zhen" is used under the guise of " ding" to represent it. Later, " bu" (like 卜兆) is added as a symbol to express the " zhen" of Zhen Bu. "Said Wen": "Zhen, Bu Wen Ye. From Bu, Bei thought Zhi. One is Ding Sheng Sheng. Jing Fang said." Some foreign scholars pointed out that the inscription " zhen" does not mean "divine question" as in "Shuowen", but means verification, proofreading, and test. In the early oracle bone inscriptions, the word " ding" was used as the word " zhen" because the pronunciation of " ding" and " zhen" were very similar. Later, " divination" was added to " ding" to express divination. In addition, the simplified form of " ding" is similar to the shape of " bei", so later generations gradually mistaken it as the word " zhen" from " bu" from " bei". Inscriptions on gold sometimes use the word " zhen" to mean " ding", which refers to a food vessel. In short, the oracle bone " zhen" and " ding" (that is, the word " zhen" written as " ding") mostly indicate zhen divination, while the inscription " zhen" mostly indicates the " ding" of food utensils, and is also used as a person's name. " Zhen", " ding", and " 鼒" are similar in shape and easy to be corrupted. See also " ding" and " 鼒".

貞字的基本解释

貞
zhēn
见“贞”。

貞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhēn］
［《廣韻》陟盈切，平清，知。］
“贞1”的繁体字。
(1)卜问；占卜。
(2)《易》的内卦。即下三爻。
(3)操守坚定不移；忠贞不二。
(4)指褒扬其忠贞的节操。
(5)旧称妇女守一而终的节操。
(6)旧称女子未许嫁曰“貞”。
(7)指无牝牡之合。
(8)诚信。
(9)指遵守信约。
(10)端方正直。
(11)坚固；坚致。
(12)稳定；安定。
(13)良善；美好。
(14)竹木等植物经寒不凋。
(15)正（与偏斜相对）。
(16)谓正轨，正道。
(17)匡正；整肃。
(18)君长，首领。
(19)下下，最低的等级。
(20)后指对赋税的减省。
(21)担当，承受。
(22)规定。
(23)征收。
(24)征验。
(25)正楷，楷书。
(26)通“楨”。主干。参见“貞幹”、“貞濟”。

貞字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　貞； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页1204第03
〔古文〕?【唐韻】陟盈切【集韻】【韻會】知盈切，?音禎。【說文】卜問也。从卜，貝，以爲贄。【徐曰】《周禮》有大貞禮，謂卜人事也。　又【易·乾卦】元亨利貞。【疏】貞，正也。又【文言】貞者，事之幹也。【書·太甲】一人元良，萬邦以貞。【疏】天子有大善，則天下得其正。　又【書·洪範】曰貞，曰悔。【傳】內卦曰貞，外卦曰悔。　又【禮·檀弓】故謂夫子貞惠文子。【疏】諡法，外內用情曰貞。　又【釋名】貞，定也。精定不動惑也。　又木名。【本草】女貞，木名。蘇頌曰：女貞，負霜蔥翠，故貞女慕其名。一名冬靑。

甲骨文金文楷体

暂无。

[①]［zhēn］
["Guang Yun" Zhi Ying cut, calm and clear. ]
Traditional characters for "貞1".
(1) Divination; Divination.
(2) The inner hexagram of "Yi". That is, the next three lines.
(3) Unwavering integrity; unwavering loyalty.
(4) Refers to the integrity of praise.
(5) It was formerly called the ethics of women keeping the same.
(6) It used to be called "chaste" when a woman was not allowed to marry.
(7) Refers to the union of no Mum.
(8) Honesty.
(9) Refers to abiding by the letter of agreement.
(10) The ends are upright.
(11) Firm; firm.
(12) Stable; stable.
(13) Good; beautiful.
(14) Bamboo, wood and other plants survive cold.
(15) Positive (as opposed to skew).
(16) It is said that the right track, the right way.
(17) Kuang Zheng; purge.
(18) The ruler, the chief.
(19) Down, the lowest level.
(20) Later refers to the reduction of taxes.
(21) Be responsible and bear.
(22) Provisions.
(23) Levy.
(24) Examination.
(25) Block letters, regular script.
(26) Through "zhen". trunk. See "Zhen Qian", "Zhen Ji".

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Beijing Department] 　zhen; Kangxi Strokes: 9; Page Number: Page 1204 No. 03
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] Zhiying cut [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Zhiying cut, sound frame. [Said Wen] Bu Wen Ye. Cong Bu, Bei, thought Zhi. [Xu Yue] "Zhou Li" has Dazhen Li, which is also called divination and personnel affairs.　[Yi·Qian Gua] Yuan Henry Zhen. [Sparse] Zhen, Zheng Ye. Also 【Classical】Zhen, do things. [Book·Taijia] One person is Yuanliang, and all nations are Yizhen. 【Sparse】The emperor has great good, and the world is right.　[Book·Hong Fan] Said Zhen, Said regret. [Biography] The inner hexagram says Zhen, and the outer hexagram says regret.　[Rite·Tan Gong] So it is called Master Sadae Fumiko. [Sparse] posthumous posthumous posthumous method, the external and internal use of affection is called Zhen.　 [Release Name] Zhen, Ding Ye. Precise and not to be confused.　Also wooden name. [Materia Medica] Ligustrum, wooden name. Su Song said: The virgin is frosty and verdant, so the virgin admires her name. A Dong Qian.

Meaning Mnemonic
You try to put your toe inside a shellfish, but it just won't open. That's because this shellfish has sworn an oath of chastity.
"No, I won't open up until I meet the toe I will marry," it says to you.
Reading Mnemonic
"Chastity is really important to me," the shellfish says. "But, maybe if you give me a tater (てい) tot, I'll change my mind."
You give the shellfish a tater tot, and it breaks its vow of chastity, opening up for your toe. You look the other way, but you can hear the sounds of passion below.
